title: "Wife Turns Into A Snake At Night And Bites Me": UP Man's Bizarre Claim
content: A man's shocking claim that his wife "turns into a snake at night" and tries to bite him has left officials in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district shocked.

title: Lawyer Who Threw Shoe At Chief Justice Has No Regrets, Makes Bizarre Claims
content: A day after he made national headlines by throwing a shoe at the Chief Justice of India, BR Gavai, inside the Supreme Court, advocate Rajesh Kishore said he does not regret what he did and accused the Chief Justice of mocking Sanatan Dharma.

title: Macron's Dilemma: What Next For France After PM's Resignation?
content: Shortly after French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu resigned after less than a month in the job, President Emmanuel Macron was filmed walking by the River Seine in Paris deep in phone conversation with only his security detail.

title: China's Premier To Visit North Korea In Highest-Level Visit Since 2019
content: China's Premier Li Qiang will go to North Korea this week in the highest-level visit by a Chinese leader since 2019.

title: In Pics: The Winter Before The Winter In Kashmir
content: It's winter before the winter in Kashmir. The famous resorts and the higher reaches of Kashmir have received unseasonal snowfall, plummeting temperatures several degrees below normal.

title: Kerala Man Stabbed During Fight, Goes To Hospital With Knife In Neck
content: In a shocking incident in Kerala's Kasaragod, a man was stabbed during a fight and was later seen at a hospital with the knife stuck in his neck.

title: 10 Tonnes Of Red Sandalwood Smuggled From Tirupati Seized In Delhi
content: A Special Task Force (STF) of Delhi Police has seized around 10 tonnes of red sandalwood allegedly smuggled in from Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh and arrested two suspected smugglers, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Israel Marks October 7 Anniversary As Talks Held To End Gaza War
content: Israel marks the second anniversary of the October 7, 2023 attack on Tuesday, as Hamas and Israeli negotiators hold indirect talks to end the two-year war in Gaza under a US proposed peace plan.

title: Arvind Kejriwal Wanted Mayawati's House. He Is Now Shashi Tharoor's Neighbour
content: AAP had asked the central government to give him the bungalow at 35, Lodhi Estate, which was used by Mayawati, but that residence was already assigned in July to Union Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary.

title: Sanae Takaichi, Poised To Be Japan's First Female PM, Faces Challenges
content: Japan's embattled governing party has a new leader: former Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line conservative who is poised to become the country's first female prime minister.

title: Shilpa Shetty Questioned For Over 4 Hours In Rs 60 Crore Fraud Case
content: Investigations are going on against actress actor Shilpa Shetty and her husband Raj Kundra in an alleged fraud case of Rs 60 crore.

title: Singer Maithili Thakur, Once Praised By PM Modi, May Contest Bihar Elections
content: There are two seats that the BJP is likely to offer to Maithili Thakur - Madhubani and Aligarh in Darbhanga.

title: Trump Says He's Open To Health Care Deal With Democrats As Shutdown Hits Day 6
content: President Donald Trump said Monday thathe'd be open to striking a deal with Democrats on the health care subsidies they've made central to the shutdown fight, cracking the door slightly to negotiations.

title: Missing Lion At Tamil Nadu Zoo Returns To Shelter After 3 Days In Safari Zone
content: After three days of anxious monitoring, Sheryaar, a young lion at the Arignar Anna Zoological Park in Chennai's Vandalur, safely returned to his night shelter on his own at 4:30 pm on Monday, zoo authorities confirmed.

title: Google Play Store Shake-Up Looms As US Top Court Denies Bid To Pause Changes
content: The US Supreme Court on Monday refused to protect Google from a year-old order requiring a major makeover of its Android app store that's designed to unleash more competition against a system that a jury declared an illegal monopoly.

title: NDTV Exclusive: He Once Built Software, Now Struggles To Survive In Gaza
content: When the latest war began on October 7, 2023, Omar Aldalou was like many of Gaza's young professionals, ambitious and quietly determined to outwit the limits of blockade and conflict through code.

title: "We're Fated To Listen To Delusional Tirade Every Year": India Slams Pak At UN
content: Speaking during the Open Debate on Women, Peace and Security, India's Parvathaneni Harish said that Pakistan conducts "systematic genocide".

title: Texas Man Who Shot Dead Indian Student At US Gas Station Arrested
content: The law enforcement officials in the United States arrested the man behind the murder of an Indian student from Hyderabad in Dallas, Texas, last week.

title: Israel, Hamas Hold Talks On Gaza Peace Plan As War Marks 2 Years
content: Israel and Hamas began indirect talks on ending the war in Gaza on Monday, after both sides signaled support for U.S. President Donald Trump's peace plan.

title: "Trade Calculations Overturned": S Jaishankar Warns Of "Tariff Volatility"
content: Trade calculations are being overturned by "tariff volatility" globally, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Monday against the backdrop of economic disruptions triggered by Washington's policy on trade tariffs.

title: PM-KUSUM scheme: Union Government likely to extend deadline again
content: Launched in 2019, the PM-KUSUM aimed to add a solar capacity of 30,800 MW by 2022, with a total Central financial support of ₹34,422 crore

title: Actor Jiteesh Raichel Samuel on his role in ‘Symptoms of Love’, ‘Khidki Gaav’ and more
content: Symptoms of Love, released on Bhavana Studio’s YouTube channel, is on an adult preparing for death without the people in his life knowing about it

title: Attack on CJI amounts to assault on soul of democracy: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren
content: "I strongly condemn this cowardly act. The attack on CJI Gavai Ji is an assault on the soul of democracy," Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said in a post on X

title: Senior advocate shot dead in Odisha’s Berhampur
content: Panda, who was also a member of the Odisha State Bar Council, was previously associated with the Congress

title: Bihar SIR hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to hear pleas first time after release of final electoral rolls
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on September 30 released the final electoral rolls in Bihar with nearly 7.42 crore names on the completion of the special intensive revision of the list

title: ECI couldn’t tell how many non-citizens removed from Bihar electoral roll, says Congress
content: The ECI's SIR exercise in Bihar has drawn sharp protests from the Opposition, which has accused the poll body of working at the behest of the ruling BJP

title: Opposition disrupts Kerala Assembly for second day over Sabarimala gold ‘theft’ allegations
content: Mirroring the chaos witnessed on Monday, UDF Opposition began shouting slogans and raising placards as soon as Question Hour commenced. Speaker adjourns House temporarily

title: Pakistan ‘bombs its own people, conducts systematic genocide’: India at U.N.
content: Speaking at the UNSC debate, Permanent Representative of India to the U.N., Parvathaneni Harish called out Pakistan for its "delusional tirade" against India

title: Can a third party be liable for marital disruption? | Explained
content: What is the alienation of affection tort? Do States in the U.S. enforce this common law? Does the Delhi High Court’s move go against the Supreme Court’s judgment in the Joseph Shine case? Can a family court decide damages against a third-party?

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE updates: ECI couldn’t tell how many non-citizens removed from Bihar electoral roll, says Cong
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has alleged that the Election Commission has not provided satisfactory answers on the issue of voter list revisions

title: Prashant Kishor says he’ll contest Bihar polls; Jan Suraaj Party to name candidates on October 9
content: The Assembly elections in Bihar will be held in two phases on November 6 and 11, while votes will be counted on November 14

title: ‘Global South scientists can tip red tape by thinking, working together’
content: Bureaucratic delays, outdated procurement rules, and chronic underfunding are all hallmarks of doing science in India. But according to Sammy Wambua from Pwani University in Kenya, there are reasons to be optimistic and to believe creativity and solidarity can keep science ticking even in the toughest environments

title: CM Stalin inaugurates hospital buildings, hands over enhanced pension to retired priests
content: The CM also virtually inaugurated 20 hostels, 37 school buildings and housing units under the Tholkudi programme, 16 village knowledge centres and nine multi-purpose centres constructed by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department at a total cost of ₹209 crore.

title: Early snowfall brings cheer to tourists; chilly weather sets in across Kashmir
content: Authorities have instructed drivers to carry appropriate safety equipment, including snow skid chains

title: Rajasthan women break social barriers through filmmaking
content: Women of all ages, once bound by the shackles of child marriage, are scripting new futures – one frame at a time

title: Infopark Kochi seeks State govt. clarification on conversion from charitable society to company
content: The clarification sought is whether Infopark should be registered as a for-profit or a non-profit company; the new corporate structure will legally enable the IT hub to own, develop, and manage such a large-scale commercial project and enter into the necessary contractual agreements for the land-pooling scheme

title: Now, scammers eye city gas project
content: With the city gas project expanding across six divisions of the Corporation, scammers are targeting customers through fraudulent phone calls. Some victims have lost money after sharing OTPs or clicking on malicious links sent via WhatsApp

title: Hibi seeks steps to ease congestion at railway stations in Kochi
content: Ernakulam MP urges the Railways to develop the Ernakulam marshalling yard as a new terminal with four platforms

title: Congress in touch with NC leadership over Rajya Sabha seats, says Tanvir Sadiq
content: The National Conference says it is in talks with Congress to finalise a seat-sharing arrangement for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections in Jammu and Kashmir and plans to field only local candidates

title: Maharashtra Minister heads anti-bribery inspection, finds hidden cash
content: Although the registration process has been fully digitised, residents in Nagpur had complained that certain officials demanded illegal payments

title: Doctors from area and district hospitals to join PHC doctors’ strike from October 7
content: At present, more than 2,800 primary health centre doctors have been taking part in protests across the State

title: Maharashtra citizens are safe as no Coldrif syrup is supplied in the State, says FDA
content: Despite no confirmed supply in the state, Maharashtra FDA urges public vigilance over toxic cough syrup.

title: Supreme Court clears deck for appointment of V-Cs to 8 State varsities in Bengal
content: The top court said appointments to varsities where the State and Governor could not reach a consensus would be examined separately in chamber proceedings

title: Odisha CM unveils ₹1,100 crore development package for Nuapada ahead of bypoll
content: Odisha CM Mohan Majhi also announced the upgradation of three regions in Nuapada to urban status ahead of the upcoming bypoll on November 11; the Congress hints at fielding Ghasiram Majhi

title: One rhinoceros dead, several wild animals feared displaced in north Bengal floods
content: While forest officials confirmed there was no major loss of wildlife in the flood-hit Dooars region, local wildlife activists claim that several animals, including deer and Indian gaur, have been found dead

title: Supreme Court orally moots transferring cash-for-jobs scam trial involving former Tamil Nadu Minister outside the State
content: If the trial is started in any other place, witnesses can depose online. If found innocent, he can resume public life and hold positions in government, says Justice Surya Kant

title: Supreme Court pulls up man claiming to be father of Russian children found in a cave at Gokarna
content: The petitioner, identified as Dror Shlomo Goldstein, challenged a Karnataka High Court decision allowing the Centre to grant travel documents to the mother and children for their repatriation to Russia

title: India ‘firm’ about ‘free, fair, inclusive and participatory’ election in Bangladesh: Foreign Secretary Misri
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said the election in Bangladesh will have to have “internal legitimacy”, and cautioned that the polls will also have to acquire “external legitimacy”

title: Assam cabinet approves introduction of Unified Pension Scheme
content: “The cabinet also approved the Assam State Tertiary Healthcare Augmentation (ASTHA) project worth ₹4,287 crore,” the Assam CM said

title: Attack on BJP MP, MLA in north Bengal appalling: Modi
content: Prime Minister says the incident highlights “absolutely pathetic law and order situation in West Bengal”. Mamata Banerjee said that it was unfortunate that PM chose to politicise a natural disaster without waiting for a proper investigation.

title: CJI Gavai’s calm demeanour is reminiscent of predecessor’s presence of mind 57 years ago before a knife-wielding attacker
content: On March 13, 1968, then Chief Justice of India M. Hidayatullah wrestled a knife-wielding man in the court room to save his fellow judge Justice A.N. Grover’s life. After a police officer cuffed the assailant, the CJI asked the officer not to manhandle the man.

title: Conclave in November to showcase ‘evolution’ of Indian science
content: It is not a mere “upgrade” of the traditional Indian Science Congress, says Science Minister Jitendra Singh

title: After central Bengaluru, signal synchronisation to ease Old Madras Road stretch
content: The plan involves synchronising a 2–2.5 km stretch between N.G.E.F. Junction and Anjaneya Junction, covering Double Road and 80 ft. Road junctions

title: Both NDA and INDIA bloc promise to form new government in Bihar
content: While NDA highlights development and governance, the Opposition pitches change and promises of a better future under new leadership

title: ‘Tunnel Road will take away six acres of Lalbagh land, damage the ecosystem’
content: Activists say the loss of canopy and green cover within a designated botanical garden is the worst kind of developmental irony

title: India’s interests are best secured by strategic autonomy: Jaishankar at JNU
content: As the U.S. ramps up pressure to end India’s Russian oil imports, and the global order unravels, Jaishankar makes a stronger case for multi-alignment, multipolarity

title: Operation Sindoor demonstrated Indian Army’s AI-driven capabilities, says Lt. General Rajiv Sahni
content: AI has become a force multiplier for the Army with enhanced surveillance, intelligence, and precision targeting, says the senior Army officer who was Direct General of Information Systems (DGIS) during the military operation against Pakistan

title: Bihar Assembly polls to be held in two phases on November 6 and 11; counting on November 14
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar also announces bye-election to eight constituencies across seven States on November 11. In Bihar, the gazette notification for the first phase of polling will be issued on October 10, and the last date to file nominations is October 17. For the second phase, the notification will be issued on October 13, and the last date to file nominations is October 20.

title: T.N. government issues SOP for operating giant wheels
content: The SOP follows certain accidents involving ‘giant wheels’, and will apply to permanent Ferris wheels at amusement parks and temporary ones at trade fairs, exhibitions, and temple festivals

title: Bihar poll dates out but coalition partners yet to finalise seat sharing
content: In the NDA, the JD(U) could contest 107 seats and the BJP 105, leaving 31 seats for the other constituents; in the Opposition bloc, RJD may contest 130 seats, leaving 113 for the Congress and other parties

title: Govt. extends Social and Educational Survey till October 24
content: Govt. and aided schools to function from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. to facilitate teachers to take up enumeration

title: J&K government removes officer who imposed social media gag on teachers without approval
content: Jammu and Kashmir Education Minister Sakina Itoo calls the move unilateral and warns that officials acting without authority will face strict action

title: PM Modi calls CJI after attack in Supreme Court, says incident has ‘angered all Indians’
content: The Prime Minister’s call and post come after Chief Justice Gavai was attacked by a lawyer who threw what looked like a sheaf of papers at the Supreme Court judge during a hearing of a case

title: Social and Educational Survey gets extension amid a range of complaints from people
content: From wrong addresses and irrigation pumpsets to abandoned or locked homes, enumerators are facing uphill task; complaints of enumerators not taking data from willing families also surface

title: Indian Army inaugurates tent homestays in Uttarakhand
content: The facility was launched in Garbyang, a tri-junction of India, Nepal, and Tibet, that holds strategic and spiritual significance

title: Oncology spending rises under Chief Minister’s Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme
content: Health officials say the amount spent on oncological treatments — medical, surgical, and radiation — was ₹142 crore in 2023, ₹147 crore in 2024, and ₹84 crore till August this year

title: Odisha extends Internet shutdown in Cuttack for another 24 hours as precautionary measure
content: Officials said the extension was a precautionary measure to prevent any possible flare-up or spread of misinformation that could reignite tensions

title: Navy commissions its second ASW-class ship INS Androth
content: INS Androth is specially designed to undertake anti-submarine operations in coastal and shallow waters.

title: Ticket seekers crowd party offices in Patna on day of ECI’s announcement for Bihar election
content: Large number of ticket aspirants were seen outside the offices of the ruling JD(U) and BJP along with the Opposition RJD in Patna’s Beerchand Patel Path with hopes of making the political plunge

title: 400 SHG conservancy workers did not report for work, Greater Chennai Corporation contractor tells Madras High Court
content: Delhi MSW Solutions Limited says all 821 self-help group workers were given appointment letters; judges direct the organisation representing the workers to respond to the complaint

title: Karnataka on high alert after nationwide reports of child deaths linked to cough syrups
content: Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao said precautionary measures had been taken although no spurious or substandard formulations had been detected in Karnataka so fa

title: Mobile phone usage hinders children’s creativity, says expert
content: ‘Nowadays, many parents hand over mobile phones to their children to make them eat or stay occupied while they attend to their own work. This habit makes children addicted to mobile phones’

title: Supreme Court defers hearing on Vodafone-Idea plea against ₹9,450-crore AGR demand to October 13
content: Vodafone-Idea’s plea against DoT’s ₹9,450-crore AGR demand will now be heard on October 13, with the telecom major seeking waiver of interest and penalties

title: Crimes against elderly people on the rise in Kochi: NCRB
content: This marks a sharp increase from the 74 such incidents reported in 2022 and just 28 cases in 2021; chargesheeting rate for crimes against senior citizens in the city in 2023 is 74.5%

title: Lawrence falls, goes from 'panicked' to winning TD
content: A "crazy" "goofy" finish to Monday night's game saw Jaguars QB Trevor Lawrence stumble after taking a snap from the 1-yard line, get up, stumble again, then break a tackle before diving into the end zone for the game-winning touchdown against the Chiefs.

title: Dodgers spin wheel play into win, 2-0 NLDS lead
content: With a dominant effort from Blake Snell, a well-executed wheel play and one fortuitous scoop from Freddie Freeman for the final out, the Los Angeles Dodgers escaped with a 4-3 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Monday in Game 2 of the NLDS.

title: Brewers cruise in Game 2, move closer to NLCS
content: Milwaukee, attempting to win a postseason series for the first time since reaching Game 7 of the NLCS in 2018, leaped out to a 2-0 series lead in the NLDS on Monday night. The Brewers launched three home runs en route to a 7-3 win over the Chicago Cubs.

title: Gannon apologizes to Demercado for sideline spat
content: Arizona Cardinals coach Jonathan Gannon said he apologized to Emari Demercado after a heated sideline conversation following the RB's unforced fumble.

title: Chargers placing top RB Hampton (ankle) on IR
content: Chargers starting running back Omarion Hampton will be placed on injured reserve due to an ankle injury, coach Jim Harbaugh said Monday.

title: Sanchez now facing felony charge for altercation
content: Mark Sanchez is facing a felony battery charge over the altercation between the former NFL quarterback and a 69-year-old truck driver early Saturday in Indianapolis.

title: Flagg displays versatility in 'fun' preseason debut
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg displayed the full package in his preseason debut, finishing with 10 points, 6 rebounds, 3 assists and a block.

title: Bills benched WR Coleman for disciplinary reasons
content: Buffalo Bills wide receiver Keon Coleman was benched for the first offensive series of Sunday night's loss to the New England Patriots for "discipline," head coach Sean McDermott said Monday.

title: ❓LeBron's cryptic post drives Lakers ticket spike
content: After LeBron's "Second Decision" tease, prices for the Lakers' home finale vs. Jazz soared, per Vivid Seats.

title: 'Beyond repair': Napheesa Collier, Cathy Engelbert and a WNBA teetering on the brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: Winners and losers of Connor McDavid's contract extension
content: No. 97 is sticking with the Oilers through 2027-28 -- with a wide range of downstream impacts around the NHL.

content: Another flash point between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri showed McLaren's ordeal in managing its drivers.

content: After clinching the Supporters' Shield, there can be no question who's on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings: the Philadelphia Union.

title: Are you all right, bud? Gujarat-origin motel manager’s final moments caught on CCTV in US shooting
content: A Gujarat man, Rakesh Ehagaban-Patel, was tragically shot and killed while managing a motel in Pittsburgh after investigating gunshots. This marks the second recent killing of an Indian-origin individual at a US motel, following a similar incident in Dallas last month. The suspect, Stanley Eugene West, was apprehended after a shootout with police, leaving him and a detective injured.

title: PM Modi shares pictures on day he first became Gujarat CM; recalls mother's words
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked the 23rd anniversary of taking oath as Gujarat's Chief Minister in 2001. He expressed gratitude to the people of India for their continuous blessings, entering his 25th year of public service. Modi reiterated his commitment to improving citizens' lives and contributing to national progress.

title: MP man kills lover, buries her in pit; sleeps over grave for two nights
content: A man in Niwari district allegedly murdered his married girlfriend, buried her body in his courtyard, and slept on a cot over the grave for two days. The woman's family reported her missing, leading to the accused's arrest and confession. He later escaped custody, prompting a police manhunt.

title: Karur stampede: SC accepts plea for CBI probe; Madras HC had earlier rejected one
content: The Supreme Court will hear a plea challenging the Madras High Court's dismissal of a CBI probe into the Karur stampede during actor Vijay's rally. The high court cited jurisdictional issues, while the petitioner argued the Tamil Nadu DGP's statements precluded an impartial state investigation. An NDA fact-finding team deemed the tragedy preventable due to negligence.

title: 'Not true': Trump says he did not tell Netanyahu to not be negative
content: US President Donald Trump has denied reports of telling Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to be less negative after Hamas accepted key aspects of his Gaza peace plan. Trump stated Netanyahu has been positive and Israel has been great. Earlier, a report claimed Trump urged Netanyahu to celebrate the development, which Hamas's partial acceptance of the peace plan had sparked.

title: SEBI's crackdown: 17-year-old IT firm & promoters barred; accused of fund misuse
content: SEBI has banned Mumbai-based IT firm Synoptics Technologies and its promoters from the securities market pending an investigation into alleged fund diversion. The company is accused of siphoning Rs 19 crore from IPO proceeds, nearly 54% of fresh share issuance, under the guise of various fees.

title: Delhi: Notorious Nepali gang leader Bhim Jora killed in encounter
content: A wanted criminal from Nepal, Bhim Mahabahadur Jora, was killed in a police encounter in Delhi. Jora, carrying a Rs 1 lakh reward, was involved in murder, dacoity, and a recent Rs 20 lakh burglary in Gurgaon. He led a transnational gang using fake Aadhaar cards to infiltrate affluent homes.

title: 'No regrets': Lawyer who tried to hurl shoe at CJI reacts; shares why he did it
content: A lawyer hurled shoes at Chief Justice of India BR Gavai in a courtroom. The lawyer stated his actions were a reaction to the CJI's comments on a plea. The Supreme Court had dismissed the plea regarding a temple idol. Security personnel restrained the lawyer. The Bar Council of India suspended his license.

title: Kohli, Rohit warned despite selection: 'Very difficult to gauge'
content: Former Indian chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has voiced concerns regarding the selection of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for the upcoming ODI series against Australia. He believes it is difficult to assess their current form and fitness as they only play one format of the game. The selectors have confirmed they passed fitness tests.

title: From Gmail to Zoho: Email switch made easy; guide for effortless migration
content: Zoho Mail is emerging as a popular privacy-focused alternative to Gmail, especially for professionals and small businesses. The service offers custom domain support, an ad-free interface, and enhanced privacy. This guide outlines a simple process to migrate your emails, folders, and contacts from Gmail to Zoho Mail, ensuring no data loss.

title: Outrage over Indian influencer asking people to get Canada PR through babies
content: An Indian influencer's advice on having babies in Canada for PR via humanitarian grounds has sparked outrage among Canadians. The video, circulating amid anti-India sentiment, suggests this as a last resort, though not guaranteed. Critics blame the liberal government for perceived loopholes, demanding stricter immigration policies and deportations.

title: Found in bathtub: Man decapitated in New York home; girlfriend’s son taken into custody
content: A man was found decapitated in his Staten Island home in New York, with a knife still in his neck. His 19-year-old stepson, who has a history of mental illness, has been taken into custody. The gruesome discovery was made by the victim's sister, who found blood trails leading to the bathroom.

title: Pune: 17-year-old rape survivor tests HIV-positive, relative absconds; POCSO case filed
content: A 17-year-old girl in Pune tested HIV-positive. She was allegedly sexually exploited multiple times since 2021 by a distant relative. The Samarth police registered a case under the POCSO Act. The accused relative from Karnataka is currently missing. The girl's health deteriorated, leading to medical tests that revealed the abuse and her HIV status. Police are searching for the suspect.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
content: SpaceX has secured a significant portion of US Space Force's military launch missions for the upcoming fiscal year, bagging five out of seven contracts worth $714 million. This reinforces Elon Musk's company's dominance in Pentagon space deals, while United Launch Alliance secured the remaining two. Blue Origin's rocket is still awaiting certification for these critical national security missions.

title: 'Conducted systematic genocide': India’s fiery reply to Pakistan at UN; slams ‘delusional tirades’
content: India strongly rebuked Pakistan at the UN Security Council, calling its Kashmir claims a "delusional tirade." New Delhi highlighted Pakistan's 1971 genocide and mass rape campaign in East Pakistan. India urged Pakistan to address its own internal issues, including its economy and human rights record, rather than making baseless accusations.

title: 'If I didn't have power ...': Donald Trump clarifies stance on tariffs
content: President Trump asserted that tariffs are a crucial tool for maintaining global peace, claiming they prevented a conflict between India and Pakistan. He stated that his use of tariffs was effective in de-escalating tensions between the two nuclear powers. India, however, maintains that military-to-military talks resolved the hostilities.

title: Odisha: BJP leader Pitabash Panda shot dead in Berhampur
content: Senior advocate and BJP member Pitabash Panda was shot dead by two bike-borne miscreants near his Berhampur residence on Monday night. The 50-year-old, also a state bar council member and RTI activist, was fired at from close range. Police are investigating the motive and have launched a manhunt for the assailants.

title: Klay Thompson posts cozy pic with Megan Thee Stallion after dodging question
content: Klay Thompson shared intimate photos with Megan Thee Stallion online, days after publicly sidestepping a question about their romance during Media Day. This move sparked mixed reactions, highlighting his preference for privacy with reporters while celebrating their strong relationship on social media. Megan has previously praised Thompson as a genuinely nice partner.

title: Who is Marissa Lawrence? Meet Trevor Lawrence’s college sweetheart
content: Marissa Lawrence, wife of Jacksonville Jaguars quarterback Trevor Lawrence, has a story of grace and resilience. From high school sweethearts to a married couple with a daughter, she's also an accomplished entrepreneur and former college athlete. Marissa now balances motherhood and her event design business while supporting her husband's NFL career.

title: ‘Leave your wife’? Steph Curry’s cryptic post draws backlash after Ayesha reveal
content: Stephen Curry is facing backlash online after posting an inspirational message, with fans criticizing his wife, Ayesha Curry, for recent comments about her life plans. Ayesha Curry's remarks on the 'Call Her Daddy' podcast, where she expressed not wanting marriage or children, have ignited a debate. Neither Stephen nor Ayesha has publicly addressed the ongoing criticism.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed on Valmiki Jayanti? Check state-wise list
content: Banks across several Indian states, including Karnataka, Odisha, Chandigarh, and Himachal Pradesh, are closed today, October 7, for Maharshi Valmiki Jayanti and Kumar Purnima. The Uttar Pradesh government also declared a public holiday for Valmiki Jayanti, separate from the RBI calendar. These closures highlight the observance of significant cultural and religious festivals.

title: 'Not time for partisan chest-thumping': Mamata slams PM Modi for 'politicising' floods
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for politicizing the recent North Bengal floods. She accused him of making unsubstantiated claims and engaging in partisan chest-thumping during a natural disaster. Banerjee urged for unity in relief efforts, emphasizing that the Prime Minister's role is nation-building, not narrative-building.

title: Starc returns! Australia name ODI, T20I squads for series vs India; Renshaw called up
content: Mitchell Starc returns to the Australian ODI squad for the upcoming series against India, alongside uncapped batter Matthew Renshaw. The selectors have also recalled Matt Short and Mitch Owen, who were previously injured. This squad marks a rebuilding phase for Australia's ODI side as they look towards the 2027 World Cup.

title: IND vs PAK: MCC shushes Pakistan; settles controversy vs India
content: The MCC has upheld the third umpire's decision to declare Muneeba Ali run out against India, clarifying a key cricket law. Despite grounding her bat, Muneeba's dismissal was correct as she wasn't running or diving towards her crease when the wicket was broken. This ruling ensures clarity on the 'bouncing bat' law.

title: Prashant Kishor to make electoral debut; claims this will be Nitish's last election
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj will contest Bihar's assembly elections, with a "full of surprises" candidate list due October 9. Kishor himself will be on the ballot, aiming to capture a significant portion of voters disillusioned with the major alliances. He predicts this election marks Nitish Kumar's final term as Chief Minister.

title: 'Should not have happened': Trump on US shutdown; keeps door open for talks with Democrats
content: As the US government shutdown enters its sixth day, President Trump teased a potential healthcare deal with Democrats before retracting, insisting the government must reopen first. Democrats deny any current negotiations with the White House, while Senate Democrats state they are willing to participate if Trump is ready to work together.

title: Rs 60 cr fraud case: EoW questions Shilpa Shetty; Raj Kundra, 4 others grilled
content: Shilpa Shetty faced a four-and-a-half-hour interrogation by the Economic Offences Wing regarding a Rs 60 crore financial fraud case. The probe involves allegations of businessman Deepak Kothari being cheated by Shilpa Shetty and her husband, Raj Kundra, who allegedly misused investment funds. Statements from five individuals, including Kundra, have been recorded as the investigation continues.

title: Rare human antibodies may hold the key to a universal cure for deadly snakebites
content: A groundbreaking universal snake antivenom, derived from rare human antibodies, offers hope against deadly bites worldwide.  Developed using blood from a hyper-immune individual, this innovative approach targets multiple venom toxins, potentially saving thousands of lives in underserved regions.  Early tests show broad efficacy, marking a significant leap from traditional, species-specific treatments.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex above 81,800
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,050, BSE Sensex was up around 50 points.

title: IND vs WI: Gavaskar loses cool; calls Windies pacers 'net bowlers'
content: Former Indian captain Sunil Gavaskar has voiced strong criticism of the West Indies bowling unit.  Following India's decisive innings and 140-run victory in Ahmedabad, Gavaskar questioned the quality of the West Indies attack.  He contrasted the current team with past legendary West Indian players, highlighting a perceived decline in batting talent.  The second Test is set for New Delhi.

title: Heavy overnight rain in Delhi, thunderstorms hit NCR; temperature drops
content: The national capital experienced a few spells of light to moderate rain at many places, accompanied by thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds with speeds of 30-40 kmph during the early morning hours on Tuesday, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Ghaziabad: YouTuber arrested for raping Bhojpuri actor
content: A popular YouTuber with over 16 million subscribers was arrested in Patna following a complaint by a Bhojpuri film actor. She accused him of rape, religious coercion, and forced abortion. The YouTuber allegedly drugged her, married her secretly, and subjected her to abuse and pressure to convert. He also had other relationships and children.

title: Coldrif tragedy: Drug to fight hooch poisoning antidote to killer cough syrup
content: A drug typically used for hooch poisoning, Fomepizole, proved effective against diethylene glycol (DEG) toxicity from the killer cough syrup Coldrif. This antidote helped save children in Madhya Pradesh who suffered severe kidney damage and brain injury after consuming the contaminated syrup, preventing further fatalities.

title: Bihar assembly elections: BJP, Tejashwi eye spring in autumn of the patriarchs
content: Bihar will vote in assembly polls on November 6 and 11. The Election Commission announced the schedule for 243 seats. Counting will take place on November 14. The elections are set to be a contest between the ruling coalition and the opposition alliance. Voter awareness and improved law and order are cited for the shorter poll duration.

title: TCS sets 6 months' pay as minimum severance
content: TCS has initiated a significant workforce realignment, impacting around 12,000 employees, primarily mid- and senior-level executives. This move aligns with increased investments in AI, data, and cybersecurity, leading to the phasing out of certain roles.

title: 'It starts for us in Pakistan': Proteas captain issues warning
content: South Africa begin its World Test Championship title defence in Pakistan, with Aiden Markram stepping in as captain. The team has undergone specialised training to prepare for the expected spin and lower seam movement in Pakistani conditions. They aim to reach the final again and lift the trophy, acknowledging that all teams will be targeting them.

title: Jaipur ICU blaze: Hospital staff ignored early warnings, say patients' kin
content: Families of victims in the Sawai Man Singh Hospital fire accused staff of ignoring smoke warnings and fleeing. Attendants claim their pleas were dismissed, and hospital personnel were the first to escape. Protests erupted as officials visited, with grieving relatives demanding answers about their loved ones' conditions amidst alleged police interference.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) and Bharat Forge. M&M is expected to resume its uptrend after completing a corrective pattern, with a target of Rs 3,720. Bharat Forge has broken out of a triangle pattern and is poised for an uptrend, aiming for Rs 1,335.

title: Only 14! India must fast-track Suryavanshi like Tendulkar
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, is India’s record-breaking prodigy - creating milestones in youth ODIs, T20s, and first-class cricket. Coaches like Zubin Bharucha and Vikram Rathour believe he’s ready to be “blooded” into India A or the senior team immediately. Grounded, fearless, and far ahead of his peers, Suryavanshi could be India’s next big superstar.

title: Trump tariffs: US President announces 25% levies on medium, heavy-duty truck imports
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a significant 25% tariff on all medium and heavy-duty trucks entering the United States, effective November 1, 2025. This move, aimed at bolstering domestic manufacturing and protecting American truck makers from foreign competition, follows a Commerce Department probe into predatory trade practices.  The tariff is part of a broader protectionist agenda.

title: Happy Valmiki Jayanti 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share
content: Valmiki Jayanti honours Sage Valmiki, the revered author of the ancient epic Ramayana and Adi Kavi. Celebrated across India, this day commemorates his birth and timeless teachings on righteousness, devotion, and virtuous living. The article offers heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes for 2025, encouraging reflection on his profound wisdom and inspiring communities to uphold truth and virtue.

title: WC: New record! Brits surpasses Mandhana to achieve this historic milestone
content: Tazmin Brits etched her name in history at the 2025 Women's World Cup, scoring a record-breaking fifth ODI century in a calendar year. Her rapid 101 against New Zealand also made her the fastest to seven ODI centuries.  South Africa's Nonkululeko Mlaba's crucial four-wicket haul restricted New Zealand to 231.

title: NDA banks on 'Viksit Bihar' plank to counter opposition caste-based drive
content: The NDA, led by BJP and JDU, anticipates a strong victory in Bihar polls, campaigning on a platform of development and good governance, aiming to move past the 'Jungle Raj' era. Opinion polls project a landslide win for the alliance, while the opposition INDIA bloc is expected to focus on caste-based politics.

title: NASA’s Perseverance rover spots mysterious interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS on Mars
content: NASA's Perseverance rover may have captured early images of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS. While a viral photo shows a bright, cylindrical object, experts suggest it's likely a photographic artifact from long-exposure imaging. Amateur astronomers are analyzing data from the comet's October 3, 2025, flyby, offering a rare glimpse of this unusual visitor.

content: the 2025-26 season turned the pregame tunnel into a stylish runway . players treated arrival like fashion week -- sharp tailoring, patterns, mixed textures and a few fits . a handful of fits pushed into fashion-forward territory -- wide-leg trousers, fine details, unexpected proportions .

title: Your guide to the Aces going up 2-0 against the Mercury in the 2025 WNBA Finals
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 91-78 in Game 2 of the 2025 WNBA Finals . Jackie Young had 32 points while four-time MVP A'ja Wilson had 28 points and 14 rebounds . despite a quiet scoring performance, Alyssa Thomas passed Courtney Vandersloot to become the all-time leader in postseason assists .
